title: Procurement Specialist
tagsAndSkills: Procurement,Buying,EPC,Buyer Activities,RFI,RFQ,RFP
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities


Policies, Processes & Procedures:

  • Follow all relevant departmental policies, processes, standard operating procedures & work instructions and ensure the work is carried out in a controlled and consistent manner
  • Ensure employees are aware and follow the information Security Rules and data security measures in order to protect the company information / intellectual properties

Day- to-day operations:

  • Develop procurement plans for all assigned packages at the start of the project and also during EPC bidding phase.
  • Establish package strategies and criticality assessments in line with project and business unit objectives.
  • Combining or splitting several packages to align with budget, schedule and technicalities or construction strategy of project.
  • Manage and co-ordinate procurement activities and deliverables of assigned Procurement Packages.
  • Establish and maintain the procurement budget
  • Establish supplier bidders lists and conduct market analysis
  • Prequalification of suppliers and issue of inquiries
  • Follow up of deliveries and progress monitoring, Material release Freight forwarding and receipts control
  • Identify and develop required sources of supply and maintain cooperative working relationships with vendors to stay current with trends and technologies, products and services.
  • Source the suitable supplier (for EPC equipment package and bulk materials) by obtaining quotes from supplier (categories which is available in supplier master, the approved vendor list for the EPC project and other techniques available)
  • Preparation of Technical Bid Evaluation and obtaining approvals from the Engineering department.
  • Preparation of Commercial Bid Evaluation by selecting the technically lowest supplier considering all aspects and obtaining necessary budget approvals, negotiate and obtain best competitive price and create purchase orders.
  • Resolve problems and discrepancies timely which occur due to non-compliance to agreed scope and delivery.
  • Expedite all the procurement process and ensure the delivery as per committed delivery date. Report the delay timely with action points to overcome the delay.
  • Submit the procurement progress report regularly for assigned EPC Packages.

Technical competencies:

  • Sound technical knowledge in procurement of Static and Rotating equipments required for EPC projects.
  • Must have experience as package responsible buyer for the critical offshore oil and gas packages e.g. HP and LP Gas Compressor package, TEG package, Water Injection Package, Rotating and Static Equipment package, Gas turbine generator package, Produced water treatment Packages etc.
  • Must have an experience right from EPC bidding phase till full execution of procurement for topside packages on major offshore projects for topside.
  • Must be able to finalize contractual Terms and Conditions with suppliers as per applicable laws / regulations of the project.
  • Must be able to lead the process and work with Engineering and other production departments during technical review of packages and scope finalization.
  • Up to date with modern purchasing methods, procedures, and specifications preparation.
  • Broad knowledge of international trade & shipping terms.
  • Broad knowledge of EPC procurement terms and conditions including warranty requirements.
  • Sound knowledge of technical terminology, particularly that use in an EPC environment.
  • Strong background with resolution of procurement issues.
  • Demonstrated ability to handle multiple procurement activities concurrently and meet deadlines.
  • Demonstrated ability to organize, prioritize and successfully execute tasks in accordance with departmental / project objectives.
  • Hand on experience in MS excel for complex commercial evaluations.
  • Fully trained and knowledgeable with relevant Safety and Occupational Health & Safety standards.

title: Manager - SCM (Stores) at Mahape, Navi Mumbai (13 -20years)
tagsAndSkills: Warehousing,Warehouse Management System,Warehouse Operations,working in shifts,Dispatch,Logistics,Warehouse management,Stores
jobDescription:
Role & responsibilities -

Position purpose:

To support manufacturing and sales function by timely delivery of material to achieve production and sales target while ensuring full accountability of material received, stored, issued and sold to customer with accuracy and within time targets.

Main tasks and responsibilities:

  • Ensure that the warehouse operates at peak efficiency with customer satisfaction the primary goal by supervising, organizing, and training warehouse employees and establishing, monitoring, and managing operational KPIs.
  • Develop warehouse operation systems by determining product handling and storage requirements, equipment utilization, inventory, gate inward & outward processes, and shipping methods.
  • Train and manage the warehouse team to solve day-to-day operational issues.
  • Oversee daily warehousing activities while controlling and managing inventory accuracy, timely delivery at minimum logistic cost
  • Maintain FIFO of all RM and FG
  • Control non-moving, slow moving, obsolescence of material by timely monitoring and highlighting to concerned departments and higher management
  • Review and prepare workflows, staffing requirements, space allocations, equipment layouts, New Equipments / Resources and action plans that meet productivity, quality, and customer service
  • Maintain a safe and healthy work environment by establishing and enforcing standards and procedures and by complying with companys statutory requirements applicable to warehouse.
  • Supervise daily warehouse activities, including quality assurance, inventory control, space management, logistics, floor productivity, shipping, and customer service.
  • Multiskilling of warehouse team, and manage the flow and quality of work to maximize efficiency and minimize overtime
  • Receipt of Customer Complaints, analysis, internal improvement actions to avoid repetition
  • Compliance to departmental ISO 9001: 2015 procedures
  • Daily review with warehouse and dispatch leads to analyse productivity and develop actionable plans for loss prevention.
  • Oversee and manage logistics for transporting products to customers and company facilities, communicating with drivers and air partners to ensure efficient delivery of packages
  • Preparation of Weekly & Monthly MIS.
  • Conduct and coordinate for plantwide Annual stock count in coordination with IT, all manufacturing departments and finance department, publish report and get approvals as per company DoA.
  • Conduct perpetual stock counting (Cycle counting) for A category parts every month as per companys process.

Preferred candidate profile :

  • Relevant experience in warehouse working in shifts preferably in engineering industry
  • Diploma in Engineering (Mech, Auto, Prod) with 15 years experience
  • BE - Mech/ Production/ Auto with minimum 12 years experience
  • B. Sc. With relevant experience of 18 to 20 years
  • Should have good knowledge of ERP-Baan system.
  • Effective Man management skills
  • Relevant experience of Handling large Warehouse and Dispatch activity operating in shifts. Thorough in warehousing processes and latest industry practices. MNC experience is preferred but not mandatory
  • Working in ERP System like SAP , Infor LN, Baan or any other ERP is must.


Perks and benefits

Best in the industry

title: Statutory Compliance Executive
tagsAndSkills: Statutory Compliance,PT,Return Filing,MLWF,Advanced Excel,Gratuity,Provident Fund,Professional Tax
jobDescription:
Statutory Compliance Executive | Mahape


About the Role:


We are seeking a dedicated and experienced Compliance Executive to join our team. As a Compliance Executive, you will be responsible for ensuring that our clients adhere to all relevant statutory requirements and regulations.


Responsibilities:


  1. Compliance Management: Oversee end-to-end compliance management for assigned clients, which includes but is not limited to TDS, PF, ESI, PT, and other applicable statutory compliances
  2. Challan Generation and Payment: Accurately generate challans and processpayments for various statutory dues within the specified timelines
  3. Return Filing: Prepare and submit timely and error-free statutory returns, keeping abreast of the latest regulatory changes
  4. Auditing and Due Diligence: Conduct periodic audits and due diligence checks to ensure clients' compliance processes are in line with statutory requirements and internal policies
  5. Compliance Advisory: Provide expert guidance and advisory services to clients on statutory compliance matters, addressing their queries and concerns effectively
  6. Liaison with Authorities: Act as the primary point of contact for government authorities, responding to queries, representing clients during audits, and resolving compliance-related issues
  7. Record Maintenance: Maintain comprehensive and organized records of compliance-related documents, transactions, and communications
  8. Training and Education: Conduct internal training sessions for team members and clients to enhance awareness of compliance laws and best practices
  9. Compliance Reports: Prepare regular compliance reports and update management on the status of compliance activities
  10. Process Improvement: Continuously identify opportunities for process improvement and automation to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of compliance operations

Location & Commitments:


  • 6 days working culture
  • Mon - Sat
  • Location - Mahape

title: Senior Design Engineer
tagsAndSkills: Solid Works,Design Conceptualization,Conveyors,Mechanical Design,Sheet Metal Design,Material Handling Equipments,3D Modeling,SPM Design
jobDescription:
AVIS ENGINEERING

Avismatic Solutions Pvt. Ltd. is a thriving food process automation and material handling systems manufacturer in Thane, MH is looking for Manager Design Engineering to join our growing team. Do you want to be a part of a company that creates a great quality product?

Post: Manager Mechanical Design


This position leads the design and development function as required for creation of capital equipment in Material Handling, Packaging Automation Projects.

Integral part of this cross-functional position commands responsibility of a team of engineers and draughtsmen that primarily works in a Project environment.


Essential Duties & Responsibilities (must possess the ability to...)

  • Perform detailed analysis of designs, create test procedures and conduct testing to verify equipment designs and analysis.
  • Creates and reviews designs, drawings, specifications, etc. involving existing technology or applications. Ensures that projects meet specifications, hygiene standard and performance requirements within area of expertise.
  • Sets up, handle and leads work flow procedures in the company.
  • Responsible for development of production drawings and manufacturing support during fabrication of equipment.
  • Provide direction and training to field technicians and production crew as needed.
  • Lead internal projects including but not limited to tracking milestones, meeting schedule and maintaining budget.
  • Customer visits may be required for initial feasibility study, product refinement, product development and installation support.
  • Ensures that projects meet specifications, standards and performance requirements within area of expertise.
  • Assist other product lines as required and other duties as assigned


Experience or knowledge of the following systems:

The candidate must have at least 8-10 years of experience in mechanical design, preferably in material handling system, packaging, distribution and conveying system

  • Visualizing, conceptualizing new ideas in working models.
  • Design Calculations for forces, stress-analysis, fatigue, product life-cycle.
  • Excellent interpersonal skills to interact with management, engineers, and designers to quickly and accurately create drawings during design and quoting processes.
  • Thorough knowledge of machine design for SPMs, conveyors, sheet-metal work.
  • Thorough knowledge of welding technology, fasteners, etc.
  • Hands-on know-how of selection of gear-boxes, motors, servos, bearings, other machine components.
  • Thorough knowledge of engineering plastics and other non-metallic materials.
  • Working knowledge of electrical motors, switch-gear, etc.
  • Working knowledge of PLCs, electronic sensors, components, automation control switch-gear, etc.


Key Skills:



EDUCATIONAL Qualification

  • Bachelors Degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent from four-year college of repute


  • 8-10 years’ experience in core responsibility applying working principles within assigned technical field; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
  • Experience in food equipment, conveyors, Packaging Machines, SPMs is desirable.





The suitable candidates can share their CVs on the following email ID:
pradnya.shinde@avismatic.com
avishr2023@gmail.com
